info.official_title: Guided by Light: Optimizing Surgical Excision of Oral Cancer Using Real-time Fluorescence Imaging

inclusion_lines.line: 1. Patients with biopsy-proven squamous cell carcinoma of the oral cavity, eligible for surgical resection of the primary tumor;

criterions.exact_snippets: biopsy-proven squamous cell carcinoma of the oral cavity
criterions.criterion: squamous cell carcinoma of the oral cavity

criterions.exact_snippets: eligible for surgical resection of the primary tumor
≥ 18 years of age

inclusion_lines.line: 3. Before patient registration, written informed consent must be given according to ICH/GCP, and national/local regulations;

criterions.exact_snippets: written informed consent must be given
according to ICH/GCP, and national/local regulations

inclusion_lines.line: 4. Screening ECG and clinical laboratory test results are within normal limits, or if any are outside of normal limits they are considered to be clinically insignificant.

criterions.exact_snippets: Screening ECG ... within normal limits
clinical laboratory test results are within normal limits
if any are outside of normal limits they are considered to be clinically insignificant
criterions.criterion: ECG and clinical laboratory test results

criterions.exact_snippets: Healthy volunteers allowed

inclusion_lines.line: Must have minimum age of 18 Years

criterions.exact_snippets: minimum age of 18 Years

exclusion_lines.line: 1. Previous surgery, chemotherapy or radiotherapy to the oral cavity;

criterions.exact_snippets: Previous surgery ... to the oral cavity
criterions.criterion: previous surgery to the oral cavity

criterions.exact_snippets: Previous ... chemotherapy ... to the oral cavity
criterions.criterion: previous chemotherapy to the oral cavity

criterions.exact_snippets: Previous ... radiotherapy to the oral cavity
criterions.criterion: previous radiotherapy to the oral cavity

exclusion_lines.line: 2. History of a clinically significant allergy or anaphylactic reactions to any of the components of the agent.

criterions.exact_snippets: clinically significant allergy
anaphylactic reactions
allergy or anaphylactic reactions to any of the components of the agent
criterions.criterion: allergy or anaphylactic reactions to components of the agent

exclusion_lines.line: 3. Patients pregnant or breastfeeding, lack of effective contraception in male or female patients with reproductive potential;

criterions.exact_snippets: Patients pregnant
breastfeeding
lack of effective contraception
male or female patients with reproductive potential
renal insufficiency (eGFR<60)

exclusion_lines.line: 5. Patients with a previous kidney transplantation in the medical history;

criterions.exact_snippets: previous kidney transplantation in the medical history

exclusion_lines.line: 7. Any condition that the investigator considers to be potentially jeopardizing the patient's well-being or the study objectives.

criterions.exact_snippets: Any condition that the investigator considers to be potentially jeopardizing the patient's well-being
Any condition that the investigator considers to be potentially jeopardizing ... the study objectives

failed_exclusion.line: 6. Immuno-compromised patients who do not have the ability to respond normally to an infection due to an impaired on weakened immune system, caused by either a pre-existing disease or concomitant medications;

criterions.exact_snippets: Immuno-compromised patients who do not have the ability to respond normally to an infection
impaired or weakened immune system
caused by either a pre-existing disease
caused by ... concomitant medications
